intro: Phebalium asteriscophorum, commonly known as the starry phebalium, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often star-shaped, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
